    Purpose: To help the store owner in keeping track of the books at the store.

        public static int inputMaxBooks(java.util.Scanner keyIn)

      • chooseAndCheck

        public static int chooseAndCheck(java.util.Scanner keyIn,
                                 int downBound,
                                 int upBound)
        After prompting the user input his/her choice, use this method to receive the choice, and check if the choice is valid. If not, prompt the user to try again, until (s)he input a valid integer.
        Parameters:
        keyIn - The scanner created in the main method
        upBound - The maximum value of user's input
        downBound - The minimum value of user's input
        Returns:
        A valid user's choice

      • createNewbooks

        public static void createNewbooks(java.util.Scanner keyIn,
                                  A1_Book[] ArrayOfBooks,
                                  int startIndex,
                                  int remainingSpace)
        Prompt the user input information and create several new books.
        Parameters:
        keyIn - The scanner created in the main method
        ArrayOfBooks - The Books array where need to create new books.
        startIndex - The first null object in the Books array
        remainingSpace - The remaining space in the book array.

      • checkPassword

        public static boolean checkPassword(java.util.Scanner keyIn,
                                    int[] totalAttemptNumber,
                                    boolean isForCreatingNewBook)
        Prompt the user to input a password, and then check if it is correct.
        Parameters:
        keyIn - The scanner created in the main method
        totalAttemptNumber - The attempt number of the outer loop
        isForCreatingNewBook - if it is true, every time users input incorrectly three times, the total attempt number add 1
        Returns:
        true If the password is correct
